summary: The quokka is a small, plant-eating marsupial native to Australia. It looks like a tiny kangaroo and is mostly active at night. You can find quokkas in a small area of southwestern Australia, especially on islands like Rottnest Island near Perth. They also live in forests and coastal areas between Perth and Albany. These cute creatures share their habitat with other rare animals, such as Gilbert's potoroo.
title: Quokka
